   20: 
   21: -module(port_bif_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   25:          command/1,
   26: 	 command_e_1/1, command_e_2/1, command_e_3/1, command_e_4/1,
   27: 	 port_info1/1, port_info2/1,
   28: 	 port_info_os_pid/1, port_info_race/1,
   29: 	 connect/1, control/1, echo_to_busy/1, busy_options/1]).
   30: 
   31: -export([do_command_e_1/1, do_command_e_2/1, do_command_e_4/1]).
   32: 
   33: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   34: 
   35: suite() ->
   36:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   37:      {timetrap, {minutes, 10}}].
   38: 
   39: all() -> 
   40:     [command, {group, port_info}, connect, control,
   41:      echo_to_busy, busy_options].
   42: 
   43: groups() -> 
   44:     [{command_e, [],
   45:       [command_e_1, command_e_2, command_e_3, command_e_4]},
   46:      {port_info, [],
   47:       [port_info1, port_info2, port_info_os_pid, port_info_race]}].
   48: 
   49: command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   50:     load_control_drv(Config),
   51: 
   52:     P = open_port({spawn, control_drv}, []),
   53:     do_command(P, "hello"),
   54:     do_command(P, <<"hello">>),
   55:     do_command(P, sub_bin(<<"1234kalle">>)),
   56:     do_command(P, unaligned_sub_bin(<<"blurf">>)),
   57:     do_command(P, ["bl"|unaligned_sub_bin(<<"urf">>)]),
   58:     true = erlang:port_close(P),
   59:     ok.
   60: 
   61: do_command(P, Data) ->
   62:     true = erlang:port_command(P, Data),
   63:     receive
   64: 	{P,{data,Data}} ->
   65: 	    ok;
   66: 	{P,{data,Data0}} ->
   67: 	    case {list_to_binary(Data0),list_to_binary([Data])} of
   68: 		{B,B} -> ok;
   69: 		_ -> ct:fail({unexpected_data,Data0})
   70: 	    end;
   71: 	Other ->
   72: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message,Other})
   73:     end.
   74: 
   75: 
   76: 
   77: %% port_command/2: badarg 1st arg
   78: command_e_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   79:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   80:     Program = filename:join(DataDir, "port_test"),
   81: 
   82:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
   83:     _ = spawn_link(?MODULE, do_command_e_1, [Program]),
   84:     receive
   85:         {'EXIT', Pid, {badarg, _}} when is_pid(Pid) ->
   86:             ok;
   87:         Other ->
   88:             ct:fail(Other)
   89:     after 10000 ->
   90:             ct:fail(timeout)
   91:     end,
   92:     ok.
   93: 
   94: do_command_e_1(Program) ->
   95:     _ = open_port({spawn, Program}, []),
   96:     erlang:port_command(apple, "plock"),
   97:     exit(survived).
   98: 
   99: %% port_command/2: badarg 2nd arg
  100: command_e_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  101:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  102:     Program = filename:join(DataDir, "port_test"),
  103: 
  104:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  105:     _ = spawn_link(?MODULE, do_command_e_2, [Program]),
  106:     receive
  107:         {'EXIT', Pid, {badarg, _}} when is_pid(Pid) ->
  108:             ok;
  109:         Other ->
  110:             ct:fail(Other)
  111:     after 10000 ->
  112:             ct:fail(timeout)
  113:     end,
  114:     ok.
  115: 
  116: do_command_e_2(Program) ->
  117:     P = open_port({spawn, Program}, []),
  118:     erlang:port_command(P, 1),
  119:     exit(survived).
  120: 
  121: %% port_command/2: Posix signals trapped
  122: command_e_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  123:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  124:     Program = filename:join(DataDir, "port_test"),
  125: 
  126:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  127:     P = open_port({spawn, Program}, [{packet, 1}]),
  128:     Data = lists:duplicate(257, $a),
  129:     erlang:port_command(P, Data),
  130:     receive
  131:         {'EXIT', Port, einval} when is_port(Port) ->
  132:             ok;
  133:         Other ->
  134:             ct:fail(Other)
  135:     after 10000 ->
  136:             ct:fail(timeout)
  137:     end,
  138:     ok.
  139: 
  140: %% port_command/2: Posix exit signals not trapped
  141: command_e_4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  142:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  143:     Program = filename:join(DataDir, "port_test"),
  144: 
  145:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  146:     _ = spawn_link(?MODULE, do_command_e_4, [Program]),
  147:     receive
  148:         {'EXIT', Pid, {einval, _}} when is_pid(Pid) ->
  149:             ok;
  150:         Other ->
  151:             ct:fail(Other)
  152:     after 10000 ->
  153:             ct:fail(timeout)
  154:     end,
  155:     ok.
  156: 
  157: do_command_e_4(Program) ->
  158:     P = open_port({spawn, Program}, [{packet, 1}]),
  159:     Data = lists:duplicate(257, $a),
  160:     erlang:port_command(P, Data),
  161:     exit(survived).
  162: 
  163: 
  164: %% Tests the port_info/1 BIF
  165: port_info1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  166:     load_control_drv(Config),
  167:     Me=self(),
  168:     P = open_port({spawn, control_drv}, []),
  169:     A1 = erlang:port_info(P),
  170:     false = lists:keysearch(registered_name, 1, A1),
  171:     register(myport, P),
  172:     A = erlang:port_info(P),
  173:     {value,{registered_name,myport}}= lists:keysearch(registered_name, 1, A),
  174:     {value,{name,"control_drv"}}=lists:keysearch(name, 1, A),
  175:     {value,{links,[Me]}}=lists:keysearch(links, 1, A),
  176:     {value,{id,_IdNum}}=lists:keysearch(id, 1, A),
  177:     {value,{connected,_}}=lists:keysearch(connected, 1, A),
  178:     {value,{input,0}}=lists:keysearch(input, 1, A),
  179:     {value,{output,0}}=lists:keysearch(output, 1, A),
  180:     {value,{os_pid,undefined}}=lists:keysearch(os_pid, 1, A),  % linked-in driver doesn't have a OS pid
  181:     true=erlang:port_close(P),
  182:     ok.
  183: 
  184: %% Tests erlang:port_info/2"
  185: port_info2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  186:     load_control_drv(Config),
  187: 
  188:     P = open_port({spawn,control_drv}, [binary]),
  189:     [] = erlang:port_info(P, registered_name),
  190:     register(myport, P),
  191:     {registered_name, myport} = erlang:port_info(P, registered_name),
  192: 
  193:     {name, "control_drv"}=erlang:port_info(P, name),
  194:     {id, _IdNum} = erlang:port_info(P, id),
  195:     Me=self(),
  196:     {links, [Me]} = erlang:port_info(P, links),
  197:     {connected, Me} = erlang:port_info(P, connected),
  198:     {input, 0}=erlang:port_info(P, input),
  199:     {output,0}=erlang:port_info(P, output),
  200:     {os_pid, undefined}=erlang:port_info(P, os_pid),  % linked-in driver doesn't have a OS pid
  201: 
  202:     erlang:port_control(P, $i, "abc"),
  203:     receive
  204:         {P,{data,<<"abc">>}} -> ok
  205:     end,
  206:     {input,3} = erlang:port_info(P, input),
  207:     {output,0} = erlang:port_info(P, output),
  208: 
  209:     Bin = list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(2047, 42)),
  210:     output_test(P, Bin, 3, 0),
  211:     
  212:     true = erlang:port_close(P),
  213:     ok.
  214: 
  215: %% Tests the port_info/1,2 os_pid option BIF
  216: port_info_os_pid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  217:     case os:type() of
  218: 	{unix,_} ->
  219: 	    do_port_info_os_pid();
  220: 	_ ->
  221: 	    {skip,"Only on Unix."}
  222:     end.
  223: 
  224: do_port_info_os_pid() ->
  225:     P = open_port({spawn, "echo $$"}, [eof]),
  226:     A = erlang:port_info(P),
  227:     {os_pid, InfoOSPid} = erlang:port_info(P, os_pid),
  228:     EchoPidStr = receive
  229: 	    {P, {data, EchoPidStr0}} -> EchoPidStr0
  230: 	    after 10000 -> ct:fail(timeout)
  231:     end,
  232:     {ok, [EchoPid], []} = io_lib:fread("~u\n", EchoPidStr),
  233:     {value,{os_pid, InfoOSPid}}=lists:keysearch(os_pid, 1, A),
  234:     EchoPid = InfoOSPid,
  235:     true = erlang:port_close(P),
  236:     ok.
  237: 
  238: port_info_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  239:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  240:     Program = filename:join(DataDir, "port_test"),
  241:     Top = self(),
  242:     P1 = open_port({spawn,Program}, [{packet,1}]),
  243:     P2 = open_port({spawn,Program}, [{packet,1}]),
  244:     Info1 = erlang:port_info(P1),
  245:     Info2 = erlang:port_info(P2),
  246:     F = fun Loop(Port, _, 0) ->
  247:                 Top ! {ok,Port};
  248:             Loop(Port, Info, N) ->
  249:                 Info = erlang:port_info(Port),
  250:                 Loop(Port, Info, N - 1)
  251:         end,
  252:     spawn_link(fun () -> F(P1, Info1, 1000) end),
  253:     spawn_link(fun () -> F(P2, Info2, 1000) end),
  254:     receive {ok,P1} -> ok end,
  255:     receive {ok,P2} -> ok end,
  256:     true = erlang:port_close(P1),
  257:     true = erlang:port_close(P2),
  258:     ok.
  259: 
  260: output_test(_, _, Input, Output) when Output > 16#1fffffff ->
  261:     io:format("~p bytes received\n", [Input]);
  262: output_test(P, Bin, Input0, Output0) ->
  263:     erlang:port_command(P, Bin),
  264:     receive
  265:         {P,{data,Bin}} -> ok;
  266:         Other ->
  267:             ct:fail("~p", [Other])
  268:     end,
  269:     Input = Input0 + size(Bin),
  270:     Output = Output0 + size(Bin),
  271:     {input,Input} = erlang:port_info(P, input),
  272:     {output,Output} = erlang:port_info(P, output),
  273: 
  274:     %% We can't test much here, but hopefully a debug-built emulator will crasch
  275:     %% if there is something wrong with the heap allocation.
  276:     case erlang:statistics(io) of
  277:         {{input,In},{output,Out}} when is_integer(In), is_integer(Out) ->
  278:             ok
  279:     end,
  280:     output_test(P, Bin, Input, Output).
  281: 
  282: %% Tests the port_connect/2 BIF.
  283: connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  284:     load_control_drv(Config),
  285: 
  286:     P = open_port({spawn, control_drv}, []),
  287:     register(myport, P),
  288: 
  289:     true = erlang:port_connect(myport, self()),
  290: 
  291:     %% Connect the port to another process.
  292: 
  293:     Data = "hello, world",
  294:     Parent = self(),
  295:     Rec = fun(Me) ->
  296: 	    receive
  297: 		{P,{data,Data}} ->
  298: 		    Parent ! connect_ok,
  299: 		    Me(Me)
  300: 	    end
  301:     end,
  302:     RecPid = spawn_link(fun() -> Rec(Rec) end),
  303:     true = erlang:port_connect(P, RecPid),
  304:     unlink(P),
  305: 
  306:     %% Send a command to the port and make sure that the
  307:     %% other process receives the echo.
  308: 
  309:     erlang:port_command(P, Data),
  310:     receive
  311:         connect_ok -> ok
  312:     end,
  313: 
  314:     %% Tests some errors.
  315: 
  316:     {'EXIT',{badarg, _}}=(catch erlang:port_connect(self(), self())),
  317:     {'EXIT',{badarg, _}}=(catch erlang:port_connect(self(), P)),
  318:     {'EXIT',{badarg, _}}=(catch erlang:port_connect(P, P)),
  319:     {'EXIT',{badarg, _}}=(catch erlang:port_connect(P, xxxx)),
  320:     {'EXIT',{badarg, _}}=(catch erlang:port_connect(P, [])),
  321: 
  322:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  323:     exit(P, you_should_die),
  324:     receive
  325:         {'EXIT',RecPid,you_should_die} -> ok;
  326:         Other -> ct:fail({bad_message,Other})
  327:     end,
  328: 
  329:     %% Done.
  330:     ok.
  331: 
  332: %% Tests port_control/3
  333: control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  334:     load_control_drv(Config),
  335:     P = open_port({spawn, control_drv}, []),
  336: 
  337:     %% Test invalid (out-of-range) arguments.
  338: 
  339:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(self(), 1, [])),
  340: 
  341:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(P, -1, [])),
  342:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(P, -34887348739733833, [])),
  343:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(P, 16#100000000, [])),
  344:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(P, a, [])),
  345:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(P, 'e', dum)),
  346:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(P, $e, dum)),
  347:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(P, $e, fun(X) -> X end)),
  348:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(P, $e, [fun(X) -> X end])),
  349:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(P, $e, [1|fun(X) -> X end])),
  350: 
  351:     %% Test errors detected by the driver.
  352: 
  353:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(P, 177, [])),
  354:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:port_control(P, 155, random_packet(1024))),
  355: 
  356:     %% Test big op codes.
  357: 
  358:     register(myport, P),
  359:     test_op(myport, 256),
  360:     test_op(P, 256),
  361:     test_op(P, 16#0033A837),
  362:     test_op(P, 16#0ab37938),
  363:     test_op(P, 16#eab37938),
  364:     test_op(P, 16#ffffFFFF),
  365: 
  366:     %% Test the echo function of the driver.
  367: 
  368:     echo(P, 0),
  369:     echo(P, 1),
  370:     echo(P, 10),
  371:     echo(P, 13),
  372:     echo(P, 63),
  373:     echo(P, 64),
  374:     echo(P, 65),
  375:     echo(P, 127),
  376:     echo(P, 1023),
  377:     echo(P, 1024),
  378:     echo(P, 11243),
  379:     echo(P, 70000),
  380: 
  381:     %% Done.
  382: 
  383:     true = erlang:port_close(myport),
  384:     ok.
  385: 
  386: test_op(P, Op) ->
  387:     R = port_control(P, Op, []),
  388:     <<Op:32>> = list_to_binary(R).
  389: 
  390: echo_to_busy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  391:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  392:     load_control_drv(Config),
  393:     P = open_port({spawn, control_drv}, []),
  394:     erlang:port_control(P, $b, [1]),	% Set to busy.
  395:     Self = self(),
  396:     Echoer = spawn(fun() -> echoer(P, Self) end),
  397:     receive after 500 -> ok end,
  398:     erlang:port_control(P, $b, [0]),	% Set to not busy.
  399:     receive
  400:         {Echoer, done} ->
  401:             ok;
  402:         {Echoer, Other} ->
  403:             ct:fail(Other);
  404:         Other ->
  405:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
  406:     end,
  407:     ok.
  408: 
  409: echoer(P, ReplyTo) ->
  410:     Msg = random_packet(73),
  411:     true = erlang:port_connect(P, self()),
  412:     erlang:port_command(P, Msg),
  413:     receive
  414: 	{P, {data, Msg}} ->
  415: 	    ReplyTo ! {self(), done};
  416: 	Other ->
  417: 	    ReplyTo ! {self(), {bad_message, Other}}
  418:     end.
  419: 
  420: echo(P, Size) ->
  421:     io:format("Echo test, size ~w", [Size]),
  422:     Packet = random_packet(Size),
  423:     Packet = erlang:port_control(P, $e, Packet),
  424:     Bin = list_to_binary(Packet),
  425:     Packet = erlang:port_control(P, $e, Bin),
  426:     Packet = erlang:port_control(P, $e, sub_bin(Bin)),
  427:     Packet = erlang:port_control(P, $e, unaligned_sub_bin(Bin)),
  428:     Packet = erlang:port_control(P, $e, [unaligned_sub_bin(Bin)]).
  429: 
  430: load_control_drv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  431:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  432:     erl_ddll:start(),
  433:     ok = load_driver(DataDir, "control_drv").
  434: 
  435: load_driver(Dir, Driver) ->
  436:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(Dir, Driver) of
  437: 	ok -> ok;
  438: 	{error, Error} = Res ->
  439: 	    io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
  440: 	    Res
  441:     end.
  442: 
  443: random_packet(Size) ->
  444:     random_packet(Size, "", random_char()).
  445: 
  446: random_packet(0, Result, _NextChar) ->
  447:     Result;
  448: random_packet(Left, Result, NextChar0) ->
  449:     NextChar =
  450: 	if
  451: 	    NextChar0 >= 126 ->
  452: 		33;
  453: 	    true ->
  454: 		NextChar0+1
  455: 	end,
  456:     random_packet(Left-1, [NextChar0|Result], NextChar).
  457: 
  458: random_char() ->
  459:     random_char("abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVXYZ0123456789").
  460: 
  461: random_char(Chars) ->
  462:     lists:nth(uniform(length(Chars)), Chars).
  463: 
  464: uniform(N) ->
  465:     rand:uniform(N).
  466: 
  467: unaligned_sub_bin(Bin0) ->
  468:     Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
  469:     Sz = size(Bin0),
  470:     <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = id(Bin1),
  471:     Bin.
  472: 
  473: sub_bin(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
  474:     {_,B} = split_binary(list_to_binary([0,1,3,Bin]), 3),
  475:     B.
  476: 
  477: id(I) -> I.
  478: 
  479: busy_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  480:     SleepTime = 2000,
  481:     SleepTimeX = SleepTime + 100,
  482:     MinVal = 1,
  483:     MaxVal = (1 bsl (8*erlang:system_info(wordsize))) - 2,
  484:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  485:     Sleep = filename:join(DataDir, "sleeper") ++ " " ++ integer_to_list(SleepTime),
  486:     Data = "hej hopp! hej hopp! hej hopp! hej hopp! hej hopp! hej hopp! hej hopp! hej hopp! hej hopp! hej hopp!",
  487: 
  488:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  489:     Tester = self(),
  490: 
  491:     %% We want this loop to write enough data to tirgger the busy limits,
  492:     %% this means that it first has to fill the pipe buffer on Linux which
  493:     %% can be anything from 4k to 1 MB, so we make sure to fill it with
  494:     %% at least 2 MB of data here.
  495:     HejLoop = fun (Prt, _F, N) when N > (2 bsl 20) ->
  496:                       Prt;
  497:                   (Prt, F, N) ->
  498:                       Prt ! {Tester, {command, Data}},
  499:                       F(Prt, F, N + iolist_size(Data))
  500:               end,
  501: 
  502:     io:format("Test1...~n", []),
  503:     Start1 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  504:     Prt1 = open_port({spawn, Sleep},
  505:                      [{busy_limits_port, {MinVal, MinVal}},
  506:                       {busy_limits_msgq, {MinVal, MinVal}}]),
  507:     T1 = spawn_link(fun () ->
  508:                              HejLoop(Prt1, HejLoop, 0)
  509:                     end),
  510:     true = wait_until(fun () ->
  511:                               {status, suspended} == process_info(T1, status)
  512:                       end,
  513:                       SleepTimeX),
  514:     unlink(T1),
  515:     exit(T1, kill),
  516:     io:format("Test1 done: ~p ms~n", [erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond)-Start1]),
  517: 
  518:     io:format("Test2...~n", []),
  519:     Start2 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  520:     Prt2 = open_port({spawn, Sleep},
  521:                      [{busy_limits_port, {50, 100}},
  522:                       {busy_limits_msgq, {50, 100}}]),
  523:     T2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
  524:                             HejLoop(Prt2, HejLoop, 0)
  525:                     end),
  526:     true = wait_until(fun () ->
  527:                               {status, suspended} == process_info(T2, status)
  528:                       end,
  529:                       SleepTimeX),
  530:     unlink(T2),
  531:     exit(T2, kill),
  532:     io:format("Test2 done: ~p ms~n", [erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond)-Start2]),
  533: 
  534:     io:format("Test3...~n", []),
  535:     Start3 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  536: 
  537:     Prt3 = open_port({spawn, Sleep},
  538:                      [{busy_limits_port, {MaxVal,MaxVal}},
  539:                       {busy_limits_msgq, {MaxVal,MaxVal}}]),
  540:     T3 = spawn_link(fun () ->
  541:                             HejLoop(Prt3, HejLoop, 0)
  542:                     end),
  543:     false = wait_until(fun () ->
  544:                               {status, suspended} == process_info(T3, status)
  545:                        end,
  546:                        SleepTimeX),
  547:     unlink(T3),
  548:     exit(T3, kill),
  549:     io:format("Test3 done: ~p ms~n", [erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond)-Start3]),
  550: 
  551:     io:format("Test4...~n", []),
  552:     Start4 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  553: 
  554:     Prt4 = open_port({spawn, Sleep},
  555:                      [{busy_limits_port, disabled},
  556:                       {busy_limits_msgq, disabled}]),
  557:     T4 = spawn_link(fun () ->
  558:                             HejLoop(Prt4, HejLoop, 0)
  559:                     end),
  560:     false = wait_until(fun () ->
  561:                                {status, suspended} == process_info(T4, status)
  562:                        end,
  563:                        SleepTimeX),
  564:     unlink(T4),
  565:     exit(T4, kill),
  566:     io:format("Test4 done: ~p ms~n", [erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond)-Start4]),
  567: 
  568:     try
  569:         open_port({spawn, Sleep},
  570:                   [{busy_limits_port, {MinVal-1,MinVal-1}}])
  571:     catch
  572:         error:badarg -> ok
  573:     end,
  574: 
  575:     try
  576:         open_port({spawn, Sleep},
  577:                   [{busy_limits_msgq, {MinVal-1,MinVal-1}}])
  578:     catch
  579:         error:badarg -> ok
  580:     end,
  581: 
  582:     try
  583:         open_port({spawn, Sleep},
  584:                   [{busy_limits_port, {MaxVal+1,MaxVal+1}}])
  585:     catch
  586:         error:badarg -> ok
  587:     end,
  588: 
  589:     try
  590:         open_port({spawn, Sleep},
  591:                   [{busy_limits_msgq, {MaxVal+1,MaxVal+1}}])
  592:     catch
  593:         error:badarg -> ok
  594:     end,
  595: 
  596:     load_control_drv(Config),
  597: 
  598:     CtrlPort = open_port({spawn, "control_drv"},
  599:                          [{busy_limits_msgq, {50,100}}]),
  600:     unlink(CtrlPort),
  601:     exit(CtrlPort, kill),
  602:     
  603:     try
  604:         open_port({spawn, "control_drv"},
  605:                    [{busy_limits_port, {50,100}}])
  606:     catch
  607:         error:badarg -> ok
  608:     end,
  609: 
  610:     receive {'EXIT', Prt1, _} -> ok end,
  611:     receive {'EXIT', Prt2, _} -> ok end,
  612:     receive {'EXIT', Prt3, _} -> ok end,
  613:     receive {'EXIT', Prt4, _} -> ok end,
  614: 
  615:     ok.
  616: 
  617: wait_until(Fun, infinity) ->
  618:     wait_until_aux(Fun, infinity);
  619: wait_until(Fun, MaxTime) ->
  620:     End = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + MaxTime,
  621:     wait_until_aux(Fun, End).
  622: 
  623: wait_until_aux(Fun, End) ->
  624:     case catch Fun() of
  625:         true ->
  626:             true;
  627:         _ ->
  628:             if End == infinity ->
  629:                     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  630:                     wait_until_aux(Fun, infinity);
  631:                true ->
  632:                     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  633:                     case End =< Now of
  634:                         true ->
  635:                             false;
  636:                         _ ->
  637:                             Wait = case End - Now of
  638:                                        Short when End - Now < 100 ->
  639:                                            Short;
  640:                                        _ ->
  641:                                            100
  642:                                    end,
  643:                             receive after Wait -> ok end,
  644:                             wait_until_aux(Fun, End)
  645:                     end
  646:             end
  647:     end.
